title.rendered: “IDF Dismantles Terrorist Network: Home of Morid Dahachah Demolished After Deadly Attack”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF soldiers demolished the home of the terrorist Morid Dahachah last night, who carried out the shooting attack at the British Police Junction on January 7, 2024, in which Amar Mansour and Dr. Lara Tanus, of blessed memory, were murdered. IDF, Shin Bet, and Border Police forces arrested approximately 40 wanted individuals in the Central Command area throughout the week.

IDF soldiers operated last night in the village of Attara in the Binyamin Brigade and destroyed the home of the terrorist Morid Dahachah, who, along with other terrorists, carried out the shooting attack at the British Police Junction on January 7, 2024, where Amar Mansour and Dr. Lara Tanus, of blessed memory, were killed. During the operation last night throughout Judea and Samaria, the soldiers located and seized a lathe for weapon manufacturing and three firearms. Demolition orders have been issued for the homes of the other terrorists involved in the attack.

Throughout the week, the forces conducted arrests of approximately 40 wanted individuals, including two operations in Burqa in Samaria and in Deheisha in Bethlehem, and seized weaponry while interrogating numerous suspects.

As of now, about 4,400 wanted individuals have been arrested since the beginning of the war across the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley, approximately 1,850 of whom are affiliated with the terrorist organization Hamas.

Attached is a documentation of the forces’ activities: https://bit.ly/3ylElfW

Attached is documentation of the demolition of the terrorist’s house: https://bit.ly/3A5QbeD

Attached are photos on the subject: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC3107202485746657
